intro: Torrubia warmingii, commonly known as the Mexican torrubia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
